name: DevOps + software Engineer
description:
IT Job offer

We are looking for a highly motivated junior DevOps Engineer to join our team at Alfah GmbH. This is a full time position in an international IT-Team which basically works remote. .

With ALFAH Parts we operate and manage one of the biggest B2B spare part marketplaces in the German market with several USP´s. With our company we supply over 5000 workshops and dealerships with roughly 25 million original and aftermarket automotive spare parts, which is the biggest offer in the market. We are a dynamic company which is growing steadily and we want to keep up with our customers and partners demand of high quality service that we provide. In order to do so, we are eager to improve our processes and IT-infrastructure at all times. For our customers we stand for exceptional service and reliability. We are located in the heart of Cologne and operate our offices here.

Your Tasks

You are very organized and can work alone on projects as well as you can communicate with other developers and Team members if needed. You love working remote and you are a highly motivated individual with a keen eye for detail and you are committed to deliver work of the highest quality.

You think you can be responsible for implementing and maintaining the tools and systems used to manage our software and processes? You want to be responsible for deploying, automating, maintaining, troubleshooting and improving the systems that keep our infrastructure running smoothly? You want to have an opportunity to apply your skills to benefit a company's mission and contribute to our success with your initiative and knowledge?

Then you could be the perfect candidate for our team!

You will work closely with our software development team to ensure that code is tested, built, and deployed in a consistent and reliable manner


Key responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including the product owner, and other engineers to develop Java-based applications on AWS.
  • Work with the development team to design, implement and maintain automated build, test, and deployment pipelines.
  • Write and maintain code using Java, AWS services, and other technologies to ensure that applications are scalable, reliable, and high-performing.
  • Develop and implement unit tests and conduct system testing to ensure that applications meet quality standards.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest Java and AWS technologies and best practices.
  • Automate and maintain our infrastructure on AWS using tools like CloudFormation, Terraform, and Ansible.
  • Design and implement a continuous integration and delivery pipeline for our development team.
  • Work with developers to identify and fix application performance issues.
  • Build and maintain monitoring and alerting systems to ensure the health of our applications.
  • Ensure security and compliance of our infrastructure and applications.
  • Document all processes and procedures.
  • Develop and maintain deployment scripts and automation tools.
  • Collaborate with software engineers to identify and troubleshoot issues with deployments, builds, and testing.
  • Ensure that development and production environments are aligned.
  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to the development of best practices for software development.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
  • 1+ years of experience developing Java-based applications on AWS.
  • Experience with Java, AWS services, and other related technologies.
  • Knowledge of software engineering best practices, including Agile development, unit testing, and continuous integration.
  • Understanding of DevOps principles and methodologies.
  • Experience with automation tools like CloudFormation, Terraform, and Ansible.
  • Experience with source control tools like Git
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Java, Python, Ruby, or JavaScript.
  • Understanding of containerization technologies, such as Docker or Kubernetes.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
  • Fluent in English (German is welcomed)

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary
  • Home office
  • Flexible working hours
  • International developer team
  • Retirement plan
  • Long term contract

If you are passionate about technology, have experience with automation tools and are looking to build your career in DevOps, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity and we would love to get to know you.

ALFAH
